title: Give me one reason how Riven is balanced...

replies.body: Eh she is a complete noob stomper in bronze you practically always win lane but in higher ELO's unless you know the specific mechanics of her kit and how to deal with your low regen you get rekt. Pretty much she is OP against people who are bad but pretty balanced against anyone who knows how to play at a reasonably high level.

Once you learn how to animation cancel with her Q then you can play her decently and you only get better from there, without learning her Q canceling you will never be a good/decent Riven.

> Pretty much she is OP against people who are bad but pretty balanced against anyone who knows how to play at a reasonably high level.

I can counter this argument easily, Darius was OP against bad players but weak against good players yet he got nerfed to the point of being complete shit, why is it ok for Riven to be broken against bad players but balanced and slightly OP against good players?

> Once you learn how to animation cancel with her Q then you can play her decently and you only get better from there, without learning her Q canceling you will never be a good/decent Riven.
> 
> I can counter this argument easily, Darius was OP against bad players but weak against good players yet he got nerfed to the point of being complete shit, why is it ok for Riven to be broken against bad players but balanced and slightly OP against good players?

Because think about it if Riot nerfs a champ that is balanced in high elo just because they stomp noobs then that champ is not viable in higher elos anymore, I guess they could try to figure some way to balance it for both high and low but come on it's Riot that would be asking  too much of them.

Did you not read my comment?

> I can counter this argument easily, Darius was OP against bad players but weak against good players yet he got nerfed to the point of being complete shit, why is it ok for Riven to be broken against bad players but balanced and slightly OP against good players?

>
> Did you not read my comment?

Eh whatever you win riven is oppest champ in game nerf her to the ground complete freelo instawin.
That's not what i was saying at all, i was just saying that your argument was flawed because i gave a perfect counterargument that you haven't responded to yet.

The scaling on her shield is a tad off, it could be changed to be AP scaing or at least half of what it currently is, because it's utterly stupid that champs like yasuo and others get a shield that scales from %hp, a resource bar, or from a really low AP percentage, and she gets a pretty high AD scaling shield that is up every 5 seconds or so. Other than that, I do think she's pretty balanced, as I've taken a dump on her with darius, yasuo, vi, you name it i've probably killed riven with them. it's all about understanding your champ and riven. If you've got a dash (yasuo), wait until she has used both q's and is going for her third, and dash past the location she wants, so you're behind her. She's wasted her knockup, and you get a few precious seconds to beat her face in while she waits for the cooldown.
Make riven a mana user DONE SHE IS BALANCED!
LeBlac is great at that but even in high Elo it's easy to get out of chain CCs. She's not overly OP but she's always been quite strong.

If you want to beat Riven you are in luck.
A lot of Riven's in bronze/silver are noob feeders which don't know how to get an advantage in lane, itemize, trade, cs, etc... 
You probably want to rush some armor/health, by late game team fights if you have a full build Sion/Rammus Riven should be fairly weak and easy to handle.. that doesn't stop her from diving onto your adc with flash and 100-0ing them, but even that is tricky.
she's melee, and completely physical damage.
